selected_quotes: Pantell et al., Social Isolation: Predictor of Mortality Comparable to Traditional Clinical Risk Factors #SDOH
Aislamiento social como factor predictor de mortalidad #SDOH
Massive US study finds that being isolated is worse for your health than high blood pressure and as bad as smoking
Social isolation predicts mortality to a similar degree as smoking and high blood pressure.

citation.abstract: We explored the relationship between social isolation and mortality in a nationally representative US sample and compared the predictive power of social isolation with that of traditional clinical risk factors.
citation.title: Social Isolation: A Predictor of Mortality Comparable to Traditional Clinical Risk Factors.

news.title: Teen Driving and Marijuana Use, Social Isolation's Mortality Risk, Gun Ownership and Homicides
news.summary: In this month's release, find new research about the rising number of high school seniors who drive and ride after using marijuana; the mortality risk of being socially isolated; and gun ownership's link to gun-related homicides.

news.title: Social Isolation Could Have The Same Mortality Risk As Hypertension: The Impact Of Loneliness On Older Adults
news.summary: Humans are so eminently social beings that being isolated has as much of a damaging impact on one's health as high blood pressure and smoking do.

news.title: Stressful Relationships vs. Isolation: The Battle for Our Lives
news.summary: If a fraught relationship might be significantly shortening your life, are you better off alone?
